cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 275 miles SW of Port-au-Prince, Haiti
cyclone.trajectory: moving northward through Haiti, eastern Cuba, then forecast to curve northwest to north‐northwest along the northwestern Bahamas toward the Atlantic side of the Florida Peninsula and the U.S. southeast coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Atlantic coast of central to northern Florida or coastal Georgia (not on Florida’s Gulf coast)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Bahamas, eastern Cuba, Atlantic coast of Florida and southeast U.S.
weather_observation.wind: Occasional tropical-storm-force gusts possible (≤34 kt) mainly Friday as Matthew passes east of the peninsula
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Gulf side; surge risk confined to Atlantic coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of rain could bring 1–3 inches locally Friday–Saturday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents along Gulf beaches
